name: PEOPLE v. MALLORY; PEOPLE v. HOWARD; PEOPLE v. LEWIS

pin_cites.parenthetical: no error to have jury view without defendant where trial judge gave carefully detailed instructions concerning the manner in which the view was to be conducted and defense counsel said he would be present

no error to have jury view without defendant where trial judge gave carefully detailed instructions concerning the manner in which the view was to be conducted and defense counsel said he would be present
Friendly, J., quoting United States v Dunnings, 425 F2d 836, 840 [CA 2, 1969], cert den 397 US 1002 [1970]
